claim:
Systematic Review
The whole search was carried out following the PRISMA method [36] for systematic reviews (Figure 1).
title: Figure 1.
caption: PRISMA flow diagram of article selection process.

claim:
Results of Syntheses
Regarding the systematic review, it is observed that the use of the BES has been increasing over the years (Figure 2).
title: Figure 2.
caption: Number of publications that include the BES instrument over time.

claim: Its progression is almost linear (Figure 3), with a linear correlation coefficient of R = 0.889 and a determination coefficient of R2 = 0.791 (p < 0.001; t = 6.45).
title: Figure 3.
caption: Scatterplot of articles published over time.

claim: The mean of each Cronbach’s α for all cognitive empathy studies, with their respective confidence intervals, is shown in Figure 4.
title: Figure 4.
caption: Forest plot of the cognitive empathy meta-analysis.

claim: The information extracted from the meta-analysis for affective empathy can be observed in Figure 5.
title: Figure 5.
caption: Forest plot of the affective empathy meta-analysis.

claim:
Robust Estimation
For cognitive empathy, the outlier analysis identified 16 studies (1, 4, 6, 7, 13, 14, 15, 16, 17, 18, 19, 21, 22, 24, 26, 28); for identification, see Figure 4.
title: Figure 4.
caption: Forest plot of the cognitive empathy meta-analysis.

claim: For affective empathy, 17 outlier studies were identified (1, 2, 3, 5, 7, 8, 11, 14, 15, 16, 17, 18, 19, 20, 21, 26, 29); for identification, see Figure 5.
title: Figure 5.
caption: Forest plot of the affective empathy meta-analysis.
